basics.name: Ben Martinez-Bateman
basics.label: Programmer
basics.summary: I've been programming and tinkering with computers since I first got my hands on them back in the 90s. I love a challenge and my favorite thing way to learn is being confronted with a problem I don't yet know how to solve—which is why when it comes to programming I'm entirely self-taught. I'm comfortable being responsible for an entire project or feature—most of my career has seen me operating, effectively, as a team of one—but I also love working with others as part of a team, both to learn and to mentor.

work.name: Human Made
work.summary: In this position I provide both technical leadership and high-quality code, building robust expert-level solutions for clients and mentoring other engineers.
highlights: Promoted to Senior in under a year
Built system used to successfully migrate a major news website to different architecture with no downtime
Trusted by clients to implement mission-critical functionality and bugfixes

work.name: Murmur Creative
work.summary: As part of a small team at a well-regarded agency with high-profile clients, I was trusted to manage my own time and priorities and delivered work that was consistently well-received. For most sites I built I was responsible for building and maintaining the entire stack, from server provisioning to front-/back-end development. As the team grew near the end of my tenure, I was involved in hiring and training/mentoring other developers.
highlights: Pioneered and advocated for new platforms and development systems that increased ROI and client satisfaction

work.name: Freelancer
work.summary: I had ongoing an ongoing relationship with Strangely Compelling Multimedia where I provided web development and localization editing for video games. I also worked with Marina Martinez Consulting, Murmur Creative, and others on contracts to build and launch websites.
highlights: Writer for Fallen Legion video game
Localization editing and voice direction for Guilty Gear Xrd video game
Interactive online book that allowed visitors to flip through books too old to physically handle

work.name: Aksys Games
work.summary: My primary role was Localization Editor, where I editing translated scripts for phrasing, clarity, and content. I also developed multiple marketing websites for numerous Aksys releases, wrote and edited several trailers for games we released, and served as the de factor office IT department.
highlights: Localization Editor on 999, Virtue's Last Reward, BlazBlue, and Hakuoki
Built and managed the website store and forums

volunteer.summary: Roots develops one of the best sets of open source tools for building, deploying, and maintaining modern WordPress websites. As a member of the core team, I contribute to development and help to manage our forums.
As the board secretary for a local business association, I attended all board meetings and supported the success of member businesses.
